result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
 Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

1:49 PM Defendant Manuel A Diaz Jr in court.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Lennon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of right to attorney.  Defendant given information regarding SPD and court appointed attorney.  Defendant wishes to represent self.  Case scheduled on duty judge calendar to address.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Hope K. 
- Defendant shall not be at the Grand Magnuson Hotel.
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

08:50 AM Defendant in court with Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez.  Lexi Keyes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:20 pm.
